citations.narrative:
At time of inspection, a livestock tank housed approximately 70 Guinea Pigs. The square inches provided (3,419.46 in2)
did not meet the minimum floor space requirements for the number of Guinea Pigs housed. Overcrowding can cause
undesirable behavior that could perpetuate harm to those housed in the enclosure. Licensee, shall relocate or add
additional square footage to meet the minimum square footage requirements.
To be corrected by: 10/1/2021

At time of inspection, there were Prairie Dogs and a rabbit out of their enclosures. To ensure the safety of the animals
housed, the licensee shall repair/replace or relocate the enclosure/animals so that they are contained.
To be corrected by: 10/28/2021
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with Licensee.
Additional Inspectors:
KONSTANZE PLUMLEE, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICEREnd Section

narrative:
3.28(c)(2)(iii) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
At time of inspection, a livestock tank housed approximately 70 Guinea Pigs. The square inches provided (3,419.46 in2) 
did not meet the minimum floor space requirements for the number of Guinea Pigs housed. Overcrowding can cause 
undesirable behavior that  could perpetuate harm to those housed in the enclosure. Licensee, shall relocate or add 
additional square footage to meet the minimum square footage requirements. 
 
To be corrected by: 10/1/2021 
3.125(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
At time of inspection, there were Prairie Dogs and a rabbit out of their enclosures. To ensure the safety of the animals 
housed, the licensee shall repair/replace or relocate the enclosure/animals  so that they are contained. 
 
To be corrected by: 10/28/2021 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with Licensee.

Additional Inspectors: 
KONSTANZE PLUMLEE, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICEREnd Section

species.common: DOMESTIC PIG / POTBELLY PIG / MICRO PIG
